review: I tried Chromecast and was very disappointed in the limited number of apps. And trying to use my cell or tablet as a remote was iffy. Usually it would work for a few minutes and then the connection between my tablet or cell and Chromecast would disappear and I'd have to sometimes re-install the app on my device. Love the Roku so much more. There are so many apps on the Roku and the streaming quality is excellent. I used to stream Netflix on my Sony Blu-Ray and I'd often drop my WiFi connection every 20 minutes or so. The Roku has been holding connections well since I got it. I can now watch Netflix movies all the way through without a drop (except for a rare occasional drop). Sound and picture are excellent. I plugged the Roku into my surround sound receiver instead of the TV. I like the Roku remote, but usually use my tablet because the Roku app on my iPad has a built in keyboard and I can see it in the dark. I always watch TV with the lights off. Roku should make the icons on it's remote glow in the dark.
author: Eddie "Eddie"

review: I've had the old style ROKUs on three televisions for a long time and love them. I found the new stick is incompatible with the Comcast system. After failing to self install the stick I spent a lot of time with the ROKU customer service who said they had a "work around".  Instead of their solution crashed my entire network.  Comcast had to come out and completely reset my network.  They said if I tried to have the ROKU stick installed again and it crashed the system again I would have to pay 150.00 (US) for them to come out and reset the network again.  I unplugged the stick, hooked up the older ROKU and was back in business in minutes.  Now I'm stuck with a product that is incompatible with Comcast and is sitting in it's box.
